articles.description: Manchester United fall to defeat by Bayern Munich at Old Trafford to exit the Champions League at the group stage.
articles.title: Man Utd out of Europe with defeat by Bayern

articles.description: England let a dominant position slip as they fall to a four-wicket defeat by West Indies in the opening game of the T20 series in Bridgetown.
articles.title: West Indies win first T20 after England collapse

articles.description: Much-changed Arsenal are held to a draw at PSV Eindhoven in their final match of the Champions League group stage, Eddie Nketiah scoring for the Group B winners.
articles.title: Much-changed Arsenal held to draw at PSV Eindhoven

articles.description: Somerset spinner Shoaib Bashir says he has had a "very special" journey from being released by Surrey to an England Test call-up.
articles.title: Bashir 'cried' after shock England Test call-up

articles.description: Henry Arundell signs a contract extension with French club Racing 92, making him ineligible for England until 2026.
articles.title: Arundell to miss England duty after Racing deal

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag says his side "should have done better" in the Champions League after they exited the competition at the group stage.
articles.title: Man Utd should have done better in Champions League - Ten Hag

articles.description: Fifa referees chief Pierluigi Collina says referee attacks are a "cancer" which "will kill football" without action.
articles.title: 'Cancer' of attacks on officials 'will kill the game'

articles.description: Real Madrid come from behind to beat Union Berlin and reach the Champions League last 16 with a 100% record.
articles.title: Real Madrid win at Union Berlin to seal 100% record

articles.description: Former Olympic heptathlon champion Dame Denise Lewis is elected president of UK Athletics.
articles.title: Dame Denise Lewis elected UK Athletics president

articles.description: Simon Hooper "devastated" after not giving Manchester City a late advantage in their 3-3 draw with Tottenham, says refereeing chief Howard Webb.
articles.title: Referee Hooper devastated by Man City mistake - Webb
